creator.description:
Fighting crypto spammers, scammers, and malicious activity in BlueSky.
 
Our AI-powered labeler detects suspicious accounts, verifies posts, and combats scams.

Report suspicious activity to help us make a better place for everyone.

discord.gg/NrzBje4s

locales.description: The "Misleading" label is applied to posts, comments, or accounts that present information in a deceptive or ambiguous manner, potentially leading to misunderstandings or incorrect conclusions. This includes content that selectively omits key details, uses manipulated data, or employs sensationalized headlines to distort facts. Misleading content may also involve vague references to unverified claims, creating confusion or steering conversations in unintended directions.
locales.name: Misleading

locales.description: The "SPAM" label is applied to posts, comments, or accounts that excessively promote content in a repetitive, unsolicited, or disruptive manner. This behavior often involves flooding feeds or conversations with the same text, from multiple accounts.
locales.name: SPAM

locales.description: Tags content that aggressively encourages users to invest in a project or token by exploiting emotional triggers like urgency or exclusivity.
locales.name: FOMO Inducer

locales.description: Flags posts or accounts that attempt to collect or expose personal information without consent.
locales.name: Doxxing

locales.description: Identifies projects that show signs of being abandoned after collecting funds, with founders disappearing or ceasing development.
locales.name: Rug Pull Alert

locales.description: Marks accounts suspected of being hacked or controlled by malicious actors.
locales.name: Compromised Account

locales.description: Flags posts or accounts spreading false or misleading information about cryptocurrencies, regulations, or market trends.
locales.name: Misinformation

locales.description: Used to flag accounts or posts generated by bots, often spamming repetitive messages, misleading links, or fake promotions.
locales.name: Bot Activity

locales.description: Tags accounts that engage in private messages to promote scams, phishing attempts, or fraudulent activities.
locales.name: Unsolicited DMs

locales.description: Flags announcements falsely claiming partnerships or endorsements to gain credibility and attract investments.
locales.name: Fake Partnership Announcement

locales.description: Identifies users or posts aggressively promoting a cryptocurrency, project, or token without disclosing vested interests or providing balanced information.
locales.name: Shilling Crypto

locales.description: Tags profiles or posts that promote fake cryptocurrency exchanges or marketplaces designed to steal funds or personal information.
locales.name: Fake Exchange/Marketplace

locales.description: The label "Potential Scam" is used to flag activities, offers, or entities in the cryptocurrency space that display characteristics commonly associated with fraudulent schemes. These may include suspicious projects, misleading claims, or unusual requests for funds or personal information. While not definitively confirmed as scams, they pose significant risks to users and warrant caution.
locales.name: Potential Scam

locales.description: Impersonation involves the creation of fake profiles or identities that mimic legitimate individuals, organizations, or brands. In the cryptocurrency space, this often includes fraudulent accounts pretending to represent well-known projects, exchanges, influencers, or developers to deceive users and gain their trust.
locales.name: Impersonation/Fake Account
